articles.title: First Blog Post!
articles.body:
** Note: This will be a super long post

So.. I finally decided to get this blog up and running!
I'll mostly be using this as a sort diary/blog/devlog.
Mostly all three and more at once to be honest...

A couple things for future me first though:
  • If you ever dare put any excessive CSS on this page I'll kill future me...
  • Anime is good, don't become like Tommy.
  • You better finish DoodleDoodleDrawDraw...
  • And also the free-games-alert project.
I thought I'd also include a list of crap happening in the world right now so I can look back
  • George Floyd protests are happening everywhere. The world is just crazy right now.
  • The US is a madhouse, honestly, the political divide here is ridiculous. Honestly it's just saddening.
  • COVID-19 is still everywhere in the country.
I think I'm gonna start posting movie/tv/anime reviews for the shows I watch.
Recently I finished Fruits Basket and I started recently Oreimo I'll write about those soon!

Man this is such a random post. I'm just glad I got this blog thingy working!!
Okay BYE!!!

- Eddie

articles.title: My Bucket List and some life reflections
articles.body:
Currently as I'm writing this it's 5:18am but I feel like i need to write something.
Even though this blog will likely never be read by anyone, which is fine, it's nice to write thoughts somewhere...

Anyways, I've been doing a lot of reflections the past couple days since I tend to be staying up super late (like right now, 5am...).
So I thought it would be a cool idea to start making a list of things I'd like to do in the future.
And the list I'll have here is going to be a live list on Github (yeah I know, kinda funny huh) because that way I can embed it Actually never mind, I cant...

It's going to be dreams I have, dreams I might never get to live or achieve, but still, I'd love to at least try, that way I can experience life to the fullest.
  Heres the list! --- https://gist.github.com/EddieFed/da1ebc2b64c363e2e73f8b692d8abca6#file-bucketlist

Anyways...
I want my next post to be a reflection on my trip to Europe last year before school.
I had meant to write about it a long time ago but I keep putting it off for some reason.
I miss the experience and making this bucket list and thinking of traveling really brings back those memories...
Hopefully I'll write the post tomorrow (today tomorrow, same thing I guess it's 6:25am).

So yeah, I want to write about my trip, but I got a couple other ideas to write about. Here's a list of ideas I have to write about
  • The trip to Europe (Like I said above)
  • My experience with covid-19 so far
  • My opinions on the world's political polarization
  • My future, college, career, etc...
  • Anime reviews like I said last post


Hopefully I can get into a habit of posting daily so it becomes a routine! (Wow I got so distracted trying to get the Github embed to work it took an hour to write this post ;-;)

- Eddie

articles.title: Crazy Anime today
articles.body:
I almost forgot to post today! Already can't even go two days straight wow...

Anyway. I did watch a couple anime movies today; I watched "Redline" and "Perfect Blue".
Both of them were pretty amazing in their own ways.

Redline was a futuristic kind of punk anime about racing, very much like speed racer but in space. It had an awesome style and very well written with pretty great music.

Perfect Blue was basically the exact opposite side of the genre spectrum.
It was a thriller, psychological horror movie, about a girl who loses touch between her own personality and the personality that people expect from her; all while being stalked and targeted throughout the movie.
It was honestly a really jarring film to watch. It's scary in the sense of how heavily people invest their lives into creating an online persona of themselves...
Here's a video I found that talked more in depth about it and made me realize what that really means nowadays versus when the movie was made.
Why Perfect Blue is Terrifying - Super Eyepatch Wolf

Also today I spent a lot of time on Minecraft with my friends, I'm in the middle of building a massive tree house since supposedly in the "master builder"
I'm not sure about that statement, but I'll take it.
We also watched that movie Redline together over a PS4 party chat and all watching it on our own phones at the same time so we can talk together, I really hope we do that again.
Being stuck in quarantine from covid-19, that kind of think is really therapeutic...

Anyway, bye bye!
- Eddie <3

articles.title: Destiny 2 & Europe post update!
articles.body:
So I started writing my post about my trip from Europe in 2019.
I'm doing it over the course of a couple days and writing it the style of a journal.
It's actually really soothing to look over pictures and reflect on them.
Hopefully I'll have it done soon!

In other news, I bought my friends Anthony and myself the season pass for Destiny 2 (Season of the Arrivals).
Hopefully it's fun. So far we completed the base quest and played a bit just for fun today.
I'm really thankful I got my friends to play games with in Quarantine, seriously, I'd be losing my mind if I didn't


Anyways, Here's a fun song!

articles.title: Diary of a Boy in Quarantine
articles.body:
So I actually writer this yesterday night at 5am, I forgot to post it and I had it saved so cool.
Begin random boring rant from an unintelligent teenager:

Hi this is a rant post just fyi :/


So the past couple days I've realized I'm pretty horrible at being consistent with anything.
I've been sleeping at 5-7am and waking up at 2-4pm or not even sleeping at all for a day.

That got me thinking. It's been exactly 100 days since I've been home in quarantine for COVID-19.
Which is both kind of crazy since my family's quarantine means literally we haven't gone out anywhere unless it's an essential.
At the same time, I've been hearing about friends out having a going away party for a friend leaving for the Navy.
For the first 2 months I gotta say, quarantine was wonderful, seriously, I felt so free.

Having had gotten out of a decently long relationship a couple months prior that really hit me hard.
I felt like I was free from the social pressures of school. After online classes and AP tests ended, I basically dedicated a good amount of time to playing video games.
Mostly Destiny 1 and 2. Which I mean they're super fun, but recently I noticed within myself I've been pushing a lot of other things aside for playing games.

At the same time as all that I have college coming up.
With COVID-19 college is gonna be so weird. I barely have any idea about how housings gonna work, let alone classes.

Along with college creeping up, a decent loss of motivation which is leading me to video games, a lot of my old friends seem to have left me in various ways
At least it feels like it. Throughout quarantine a couple people have asked me early on when things started opening to hang out.After saying no to them, it seems nobody wants to talk to me.
It's kinda hard considering I liked to talk to everyone. There's few people I enjoy playing games with, and I'm lucky to have them, but most people I only like talking in person.
(In general I'm not a gamer, so that's why there's only a couple people I like gaming with, that probably came off as pretty pretentious though).

I really don't know what to do, every night.
I stay up until 6am thinking about how I feel lonely, I wake up at 2pm to play games for a couple hours, eat dinner, help my family with sorting stuff in the house for donating
(quarantine got us to start some spring cleaning and it's been going on forever), and sleep. It's an endless cycle that isn't gonna end any time soon.

I've been trying to brainstorm things to get me into a good routine. A couple of my ideas are:
  • Sleeping schedule midnight -7:30am.
  • Start limiting video games to 7:30am-noon. Occasionally other times but mostly around that time. I would like to work on projects and help around the house without being distracted by games.
  • Start a regular work out routine where I run right when I wake up, then work out and shower after. Setting up my day good.
They're weird goals, but I need some consistency in my life now.
At first inconsistently feels truly liberating until it becomes uncontrollable.
Then it becomes destructive, and that's where I'm at right now.
So in order to combat the growing depressiveness in my mood and everyday life I think I'll start doing that.

If you read this, you're super weird, just sayin'. But thanks for reading if you did <3

Oh yeah... I used to have Spotify Premium since I worked at Starbucks, now that I don't, it sucks. Just sayin'.
